subject: Creativity
title: Three Types of Imagination: Sensory, Creative, Fantastical
description: One-minute skill: Three Types of Imagination: Sensory, Creative, Fantastical.

hook.text: Imagination isn't one thing. Psychologists identify at least three distinct types, each serving different purposes.

buildup.text: Sensory imagination recreates experiences ‚Äî the taste of coffee, the sound of rain. It's memory-based simulation.

discovery.text: Creative imagination recombines existing elements into novel configurations ‚Äî a flying car, a story that hasn't been.

twist.text: Fantastical imagination breaks known rules entirely ‚Äî magic, time travel, impossible physics.

climax.text: Each type uses different brain networks. Training one doesn't automatically improve the others ‚Äî they're separate.

punchline.text: Imagination has three gears. Most people only use first.

quiz.question: Which type of imagination breaks known physical rules entirely?
